intro: [WRONG START] Sorbus thuringiaya subsp. boscii, commonly known as the Bohemian whitebeam, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces small, orange to red berries that are edible but not particularly flavorful. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical, with serrated edges, and turn reddish in the fall. This subspecies is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
